name: forex_30q_yes_no
title: 30 Yes/No Forex Questions (News/Text Analysis)
description: Binary macro/news questionnaire scored per currency. YES=1, NO=0 per question; compute base-vs-quote net to derive signal.

variables.name: texts
variables.description: Recent news headlines/summaries/bodies for both currencies.

questions.text: Did the central bank's latest statement suggest a hawkish stance?
Are interest rate expectations for this currency trending upward in recent commentary?
Did the central bank indicate satisfaction with current inflation levels?
Are monetary policy meeting minutes described as supportive of the currency?
Is the central bank governor's recent speech tone confident about the economy?
Are there mentions of potential policy tightening in the near term?
Did the central bank raise or maintain (not cut) rates in the latest decision?
Is the central bank's inflation target being met according to recent reports?
Did the latest GDP report show growth or stability?
Are employment/unemployment figures described as improving or strong?
Are manufacturing PMI readings reported as above 50 (expansion)?
Are services PMI readings reported as above 50 (expansion)?
Is consumer spending described as robust or increasing?
Are trade balance figures improving or showing surplus?
Is business confidence reported as rising or high?
Is inflation described as stable or declining toward target?
Are wage growth figures mentioned as moderate (not too high/low)?
Are commodity prices impacting this currency positively?
Are producer prices stable or declining according to reports?
Is core inflation (excluding food/energy) within acceptable range?
Is the political situation described as stable in recent news?
Is the government described as stable without crisis mentions?
Are election outcomes (if any) described as market-friendly?
Are geopolitical risks involving this country low or decreasing?
Is the country's credit rating stable or upgraded in recent news?
Are foreign investors described as increasing exposure to this currency?
Is this currency mentioned as a safe-haven in recent market commentary?
Are capital inflows to this country reported as strong or increasing?
Is demand for this currency's bonds/assets described as healthy?
Are currency strategists/analysts expressing positive views on this currency?

prompt.system: You are a precise macro/FX analyst. Answer strictly with JSON.
prompt.instructions: For each currency independently (BASE then QUOTE), evaluate the provided news texts. For every question, answer YES if the texts support a bullish interpretation for that currency; otherwise answer NO. Be decisive and avoid hedging. Do not use outside knowledge beyond the timeframe.
notes: Run the full 30 questions for BASE, then repeat for QUOTE.
Provide a brief one-sentence explanation for each answer.

response_template.rationale: Optional short summary of key drivers.
